facts.fact: Dogs may pretend to be sick to get more attention from their owners.
Cats sleep for around 70% of their lives which can be up to 16 hours a day.
Dogs can smell when their owners are afraid thanks to their perspiration.
A cat’s brain is 90% similar to the human brain.
A study at UCSD claims that dogs can get jealous when their owners show fondness toward other creatures.
Happy rabbits like to hop and do a twist in the air...this act is also known as a “binky”.
Cats can rotate their ears up to 180º.
Dogs in Russia have taught themselves to ride the subway and can figure out which stops lead to food.
Rats laugh when they’re tickled.
Dogs have a sense of time and can get accustomed to their schedules in terms of meal times and when they’ll be taken for a walk.
Female cats tend to be right-pawed and male cats tend to be left-pawed.
Dogs have such a powerful sense of smell
Rabbit teeth never stop growing; tough plant food helps to wear them down.
Dogs curl up when they sleep because of instinct...it helps to keep them warm and protect themselves.
Owning a cat can lower a person’s risk of stroke and heart attack by a third.
One survey claims that a man’s chance of getting a girl’s phone number more than triples when they’re with a dog.
After reaching maturity
Petting a puppy can help lower your blood pressure.
Rabbits clean themselves by licking their paws just like cats do.
Some dogs have been known to stop and smell certain plants
